intro: Lotononis dinteri, commonly known as the Dinter's lotononis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
